Title: AtCoder Regular Contest 200 (Div. 2)
Name: Movie Theater
Problem Statement:
You are given a positive integer N and sequences of positive integers of length N: L=(L_1,L_2,...,L_N),R=(R_1,R_2,...,R_N). It is guaranteed that L_1,L_2,...,L_N,R_1,R_2,...,R_N are all distinct.
A movie theater has N seats arranged in a row from left to right. The i-th seat from the left is called seat i.
N people, numbered 1 to N, visit this movie theater. You assign one seat to each person. Let P_i be the seat assigned to person i. Then, person i arrives at time L_i, crosses seats 1,2,...,P_i-1 to sit in seat P_i, and leaves at time R_i, crossing seats 1,2,...,P_i-1 to exit.
The dissatisfaction of person i is the number of times other people cross seat P_i during the time interval from time L_i to time R_i (not including exactly L_i and R_i).
Find the lexicographically smallest permutation P of (1,2,...,N) that minimizes the total dissatisfaction of all people from 1 to N.
You are given T test cases, so find the answer for each.
Constraints:
- 1≤ T≤ 500
- 1≤ N≤ 500
- 1≤ L_i < R_i≤ 2\times N
- L_1,L_2,...,L_N,R_1,R_2,...,R_N are all distinct.
- The sum of N over all test cases is at most 500.
- All input values are integers.
IO Styles:
Input
The input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
T
\text{case}_1
\text{case}_2
\vdots
\text{case}_T
Each test case is given in the following format:
N
L_1 R_1
L_2 R_2
\vdots
L_N R_N
Output
Output T lines.
The i-th line should contain the lexicographically smallest permutation P of (1,2,...,N) that minimizes the total dissatisfaction of all people from 1 to N for the i-th test case, separated by spaces.

Sample Detail.explanation:
For the first test case, if we set P=(2,1,3), the process proceeds as follows:

- Time 1: Person 1 sits in seat 2.
- Time 2: Person 2 sits in seat 1.
- Time 3: Person 2 leaves seat 1.
- Time 4: Person 3 sits in seat 3. Person 1's dissatisfaction increases by 1.
- Time 5: Person 1 leaves seat 2.
- Time 6: Person 3 leaves seat 3.


The total dissatisfaction of all people in this case is 1.

It is impossible to make the total dissatisfaction smaller than 1, and furthermore, P=(2,1,3) is lexicographically smallest among all P with total dissatisfaction of 1. Therefore, P=(2,1,3) is the answer.

For the second test case, the total dissatisfaction of all people is 6 for any permutation P.
